thread.title: Six New England Patriots Now Intend to Skip White House Ceremony
thread.title_full: Six New England Patriots Now Intend to Skip White House Ceremony

author: Joe DePaolo
title: Six New England Patriots Now Intend to Skip White House Ceremony
text:
Six New England Patriots Now Intend to Skip White House Ceremony by Joe DePaolo | 10:41 am, February 10th, 2017 
Six New England Patriots have now stated their intentions to skip the White House ceremony honoring the Super Bowl champions later this year. 
On Monday, we posted about Patriots tight end Martellus Bennett ‘s plans not to make the trip to the White House. Since then, five of his teammates have declared that they too will not attend; running back LaGarrette Blount , defensive lineman Alan Branch , linebacker Dont’a Hightower , defensive end Chris Long , and defensive back Devin McCourty . 
Branch and Hightower have not cited politics or President Donald Trump in particular as reasons they are skipping the ceremony. (Hightower also skipped the ceremony in 2015 following the team’s Super Bowl XLIX win.) The other four players, however, have either hinted at or outright stated that they will not partake in the ceremony for political reasons. 
“I don’t feel accepted in the White House,” McCourty said, according to Time . With the President having so many strong opinions and prejudices, I believe certain people might feel accepted there while others won’t.” 
“I just don’t feel welcome into that house,” Blount said on The Rich Eisen Show “I’m just gonna leave it at that.” 
[ image via screengrab ]
